qas.question: What was the name of the ship that Napoleon sent to the Black Sea?
Sending a ship to the Black Sea violated the terms made during what agreement?
Who felt threaten by France's force and ended up signing a new treaty?
Who previously held the keys to the Church of the Nativity?
Who held authority over Roman Catholic holy places after Sultan Abdülmecid I agreed to the new treaty?

answers.text: France and the Roman Catholic Church

context: Napoleon III responded with a show of force, sending the ship of the line <a0_0>Charlemagne<a0_0/> to the Black Sea. This action was a violation of the <a1_0>London Straits Convention<a1_0/>.:104:19 Thus, France's show of force presented a real threat, and when combined with aggressive diplomacy and money, induced the Ottoman <a2_0>Sultan Abdülmecid I<a2_0/> to accept a new treaty, confirming <a4_0>France and the Roman Catholic Church<a4_0/> as the supreme Christian authority with control over the Roman Catholic holy places and possession of the keys to the Church of the Nativity, previously held by the <a3_0>Greek Orthodox Church<a3_0/>.:20
